result.execSummary:
The defendant Hannah Gretchen O'Brochta was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Penalty-Theft if Value <=$2500], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant granted Huber privileges under rules and regulations of the Columbia County Jail, Sentence is TIME SERVED

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

9:42 AM Defendant Hannah Gretchen O'Brochta in court.  Attorney Allison J Borsheim in court for Hannah Gretchen O'Brochta.  Prosecuting attorney Peggy A. Crooks-Mishacoff in court for the State of Wisconsin. Rights/Elements, Defendant pleads no contest to Ct. 1, Court finds defendant guilty, Judgment to be entered, Court sentences defendant to: 8 days jail w/Huber, 6 days sentence credit, sentence is TIME SERVED, $453.00 costs, due in 60 days or payment plan, defendant to submit DNA Sample, 9:52 A.M.
